item.title: Unsafe Driving behaviour and volume of cars, 24th April
item.description:
Withyfield road is use as a car park and cut through/rat run by so many people. Drivers often speed up and down the road without concern for the families who live there. Residents resort to parking on the road to act as a speed deterrent. The cars that park on the road often park around the bend not allowing any visibility. Also, With a new dwelling about to built on longlands road, parking and congestion will increase. The road layout, when constructed originally was going to be a cul-de-sac, can we not look at changing the layout to stop the road being used as a cut through/rat run. On a side note, I've nearly been hit 3 times by people speeding up the road whilst attempting to get my daughter out of the car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withyfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 24th April
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing on behalf of Brockworth RFC. We have a situation where the club driveway now exits on to an access road to a new development known as Stilchester Road. The new road now has bi-directional traffic for the first time and as a committee, we are concerned for the safety of both motor vehicles exiting the BRFC driveway and the new Stilchester Road users. We feel a sensible solution would be to install a ‘GIVE WAY’ sign at the end of our driveway. Could you please advise us how we proceed with an application to Gloucestershire Highways Department for this important road safety sign to be installed as soon as possible? We look forward to hearing from you. Your faithfully.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain in farm lane. Previous tickets on this are showing as closed but there is still standing water in the storm drain and the cover is off and red barriers surround the drain. Whilst I am told CCTV is going to be ordered to source the blockage no date is yet provided, 24th April
